model

Class Melody

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Melody

  • public class Melody
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Melody class which controls the way in which a melody is created by choosing a note. The octave will then be played one note at a time.
    Version:
    1.0.0.0
    Author:
    Jordan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Note note 
      private java.util.Scanner sc 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Melody()
      This is the main constructor that will instantiate the global Note variable and the global Scanner variable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Melody

        public Melody()
        This is the main constructor that will instantiate the global Note variable and the global Scanner variable.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method is the main menu of the melody system. It will ask for user input and then change the menu based on the users decision. If there are any invalid inputs, it will let the user know and then give the options to the user again.

      • createNoteWritten

        private void createNoteWritten()
        This method is if the user is trying to write a note using a String value. If the note is invalid, the user will be notified and can try again. If the note is too high and an octave cannot be formed, the user can try again. If they wish to go back, they can write 'back' and be returned to the main menu. If the value is good, it will go to the playMelody() method.

      • createNoteSemitones

        private void createNoteSemitones()
        This method is if the user is trying to write a note using semitones. If the note is invalid, the user will be notified and can try again. If the note is too high and an octave cannot be formed, the user can try again. If they wish to go back, they can write 'back' and be returned to the main menu. If the value is good, it will go to the playMelody() method.

      • createNoteFreq

        private void createNoteFreq()
        This method is if the user is trying to write a note using a String value. If the note is invalid, the user will be notified and can try again. If the note is too high and an octave cannot be formed, the user can try again. If they wish to go back, they can write 'back' and be returned to the main menu. If the value is good, it will go to the playMelody() method.

      • playMelody

        private void playMelody()
        This method is what will play the notes from the value given by the user. It will play a single note incrementally upwards until it reaches its octave.
